messages.m: We love WebPageTest! It's a super cool Open Source web performance tool created by Patrick Meenan.
Do you want to know more about web performance? Checkout the hash tags #webperf and #perfmatters on Twitter.
Have you read Steve Souders blog post about how to measure the load time of your hero image?
Stefan Judis & Marco Biedermann runs Perf Tooling Today - a collection of resources which will help you to improve your workflow and to deliver better and faster websites.
Have you read the story about sitespeed.io?
Want to continously test your site? Test the Open Source Web Performance Dashboard.
Want to know more about how to foster a culture around web performance in organizations? Checkout Katie Kovalcin and Tim Kadlec podcast Path To Performance.
Do you know that Andy Davies was the only in the world who scored 100% in the SpeedGeek challenge? You better follow him on Twitter!
Woman Who Code is a non-profit dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers. You could and should support them!
Ilya Grigorik is a web performance engineer and developer advocate at Google and you should follow him on Github and Twitter because he knows alot about web performance!
Steve Souders is the Godfather of web performance. Make sure you check out his blog!
Wesley Hales created speedgun.io - a really cool Open Source web performance tool based on PhantomJS.
Read the excellent posts by Tim Kadlec about Setting a performance budget and Fast enough.
Do you use a Mac and need to optimize your images? Use ImageOptim by Kornel Lesi≈Ñski, it is awesome!
Much love love love to the Swedish Internet Foundation for funding the first version of the online version of sitespeed.io
Your Name Here? Yep, do you have any cool Web Performance Open Source tool/article you want to share to the world? Send a pull request with your addition.
Sitespeed.io is Open Source and so is the online version. Check out the code here and help us make it better!
HTTP/2 is here, let's optimize! Check out Ilya Grigoriks great slides.
The sitespeed.io logo is made by Mochamad Arief, you can find his stuff at http://www.mochawalk.com/.
Have you read Wesley Hales article about Simulated RUM testing with PhantomJS 2?
Khalid Lafi:s PerfBar is an Open Source Javascript that you include in your page to keep track of your performance metrics.
